title: Workers want to embrace A.I. — but only 1 in 10 say their jobs involve related skills, Salesforce says
description: "More workers were excited about its use in their workplace (58%) than worried about it replacing them in their job (42%)," said the cloud software company.

title: Britain launches $1.2 billion semiconductor plan after U.S. and EU splurge on chips
description: The U.K. is seeking to boost its domestic chipmaking capabilities and prevent further disruptions to supply after cries for help from bosses at some of the country's leading firms.

title: Tractor maker Deere's future in precision agriculture hinges on space-based connectivity
description: The company, like competitors CNH Industrial and AGCO, has been investing in precision agriculture using sensors, software and data analytics.

title: Disney scraps plans for new Florida campus, mass employee relocation amid DeSantis feud
description: Disney and Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis are entangled in a bitter feud centered in part around the company's special district and development plans.

title: CDC urges mpox vaccination among people at high risk to prevent summer surge
description: The CDC's call for those at risk to get up to date on their vaccines comes after a cluster of at least 21 mpox cases was reported in Chicago.

title: Meta pulls the curtain back on its A.I. chips for the first time
description: Meta revealed that it built a video-processing computer chip and another chip to help with A.I. tasks like recommendations.

title: McCarthy says House could vote on debt ceiling deal as soon as next week
description: "I just believe where we were a week ago and where we are today is a much better place," said McCarthy, sounding more optimistic than ever about a deal.

title: Queen Elizabeth II's funeral cost over $200 million, UK government reveals
description: The state funeral for the U.K.'s longest-serving monarch and related events in September cost around £162 million ($201.4 million).

title: A secretive annual meeting attended by the world's elite has A.I. top of the agenda
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman will join forces with key leadership from Microsoft, DeepMind and Google Thursday as the secretive Bilderberg meeting kickstarts in Lisbon.

title: How luxury giant LVMH built a recession-proof empire
description: LVMH has built a powerful portfolio of 75 brands. In 2023, it became the first European company to reach a $500 billion value.

title: Alibaba shares dip as quarterly revenues miss expectations
description: Alibaba posted a jump in revenue and profit in the company's first quarterly earnings report  since the Chinese e-commerce giant split into six units.

title: As G-7 Summit kicks off in Hiroshima, China and Russia are on everyone’s minds
description: The leaders of the seven major industrial democracies will discuss the future of the global relations and its economy as the world faces a number of uncertainties.

title: Market's tech focus is 'shortsighted,' with a broader bull run coming, portfolio manager says
description: The market's affinity for Big Tech stocks this year is shortsighted, according to portfolio manager Freddie Lait, who said the next bull market phase will broaden out.

title: Global debt nears record highs as rate hikes trigger 'crisis of adaptation,' top trade body says
description: Global debt grew by $8.3 trillion in the first quarter of 2023 to a near-record high of $305 trillion.

title: British telecom giant BT to cut up to 55,000 jobs by 2030
description: The company intends to reduce staffing by 40,000 to 55,000 roles.

title: Ripple CEO says more crypto firms may leave U.S. due to 'confusing' rules
description: More crypto firms may leave the U.S. for more progressive jurisdictions like Europe if regulators continue to crack down on them, said Ripple CEO.

title: 'It's a no-brainer': U.S. beats UK investment scene, says British MP, calling for radical overhaul
description: Britain's opposition finance minister on Tuesday lambasted the country's business environment under the current Conservative government.

title: How the U.S. and South Africa ended up in a dispute over Russian gunrunning allegations
description: Relations between the U.S. and South Africa frayed last week, when U.S. Ambassador Reuben Brigety accused Pretoria of running guns for Russia via a mystery merchant ship.

title: Bank of England governor says the UK is facing a wage-price spiral
description: Andrew Bailey said second-round effects of wage growth and price setting were "unlikely to go away as quickly as they appeared."

title: This trader's got the 'perfect' job for full-time travel — and he's teaching others how to do it
description: Boat life, van life, backpacking, motorhomes — Patrick Schulte says he's done it all. Now he's teaching others how to trade to live a life of constant travel.

title: Goldman Sachs says A.I. could push S&P 500 profits up by 30% in the next decade
description: Productivity gains driven by artificial intelligence is a real source of optimism for future earnings growth among S&P 500 companies, Goldman Sachs says.

title: Deutsche Bank agrees to pay $75 million to Jeffrey Epstein victims to settle lawsuit
description: JPMorgan Chase still faces lawsuits by accusers of sex criminal Jeffrey Epstein and the government of the U.S. Virgin Islands.
